body_html:
Yep it is.

On Oct 11, 2016 8:18 PM, "Yandi Xia" notifications@github.com wrote:

@ebrevdo https://github.com/ebrevdo

It is good to know that tf.train.batch can take placeholder as input.
Thanks.

"Do you plan to feed input directly in one
python thread, and have the eval running in a separate thread?"
Yes, I create a thread for enqueue, and the input of the evaluation graph
is the result of dequeue. After all the data in test set is enqueued, the
thread halts and waits for the evaluation to be done.
This is how TensorFlow FIFOQueue works, right? The producer/consumer style?

Thanks

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

> It is good to know that tf.train.batch can take placeholder as input.

> python thread, and have the eval running in a separate thread?"
> Yes, I create a thread for enqueue, and the input of the evaluation graph
> is the result of dequeue. After all the data in test set is enqueued, the
> thread halts and waits for the evaluation to be done.
> This is how TensorFlow FIFOQueue works, right? The producer/consumer style?
> 
> Thanks
